column1: Happy Thanksgiving to all the  #FL05 residents! This year has shown us how unexpected life can be. I hope that your day is full of love laughter and plenty of stuffing! Stay safe and enjoy the holiday. https://t.co/BzZYF9pfjC
Congratulations to the 2020 Florida Veterans Hall of Fame inductees. Thank you to every servicemember who has sworn to defend our country and the values it stands for.    https://t.co/unl46DfQX3

Two USDA scholarships are available for students attending Historically Black Colleges and Universities and tribal land-grant colleges and universities. For more information visit the USDA Minority-Serving Higher Education website.  https://t.co/Vs028td7a9

Happy #VeteransDay to all who served. Take a moment to honor the brave servicemembers who answered the call to defend our country & fight for the ideals it was founded on – life liberty and the pursuit of happiness. https://t.co/bMyMZarseg

Americans will lose pre-existing condition protections if the GOP succeeds in dismantling the Affordable Care Act 🩺No more preventative care requirement 💊 No more pre-existing condition protections 🤒 No more Medicaid expansion 👭 Women will be charged more for care #SaveTheACA

Constantly moving and being away from loved ones can be hard for military families but the sacrifices they make for both our servicemembers and our country has not gone unnoticed. To them we say thank you.    #MilitaryFamilyMonth https://t.co/bcog7Y65We

Want to know what’s scary? If the hundreds of bills that could help millions of Americans continue to sit on Mitch McConnell’s desk through the end of session. Call your senator and encourage them to take up legislation that will help so many in our community. https://t.co/eBmtCGKcmY
Today we celebrate Navy Day and recognize all of the brave men and women of the United States Navy — past and present! Thank you for your service! #NavyDay2020 https://t.co/Xj2TAF7VzD

Millions rely on broadband to work and study from home. And millions still don’t have the have access they need. Instead of abandoning net neutrality and America’s unconnected we should restore #NetNeutrality and ensure everyone has reliable and affordable broadband. https://t.co/7pses3lTPq
No one should face eviction during a PANDEMIC. If you’re having trouble paying rent you may qualify for eviction protection. Visit https://t.co/GvU9adi7AY for more information. #KnowYourRights

Equality is the cornerstone of dignity in our country. I’m honored to receive a perfect score from @HRC in their Congressional Scorecard and will continue championing LGBTQ rights until true equality is achieved! #HRCscorecard Link: https://t.co/xbHUz5iG5x https://t.co/3a872c0iTi
https://t.co/cwiUYhr8lJ

The SBA recently released a simpler loan forgiveness application for Paycheck Protection Program loans of $50000 or less. This action streamlines the PPP forgiveness process to provide financial & administrative relief to America’s smallest businesses.  https://t.co/sV289GKMph
As we spend more time at home #SocialDistancing self-care is more important than ever. Share your favorite self-care activities! #MentalHealthMatters https://t.co/AooHkVQuaI

I'm pleased that my efforts to extend pandemic SNAP waivers and EBT extensions to families who are struggling to eat during this difficult time was included in the recently passed bipartisan continuing resolution. https://t.co/Ikv2yYTXrd
I am praying that the President and First Lady have a speedy and full recovery.
In honor of #SmallBusinessWeek here's a photo of the time I visited the French Pantry in Jacksonville which helps to make up the vibrant #smallzbiz community in #FL05 https://t.co/34vQZqLT4B

It shouldn't take the ash of these wildfires the debris & flood waters of the hurricanes or the heat felt by millions across the nation for this Congress to take action on the environmental crisis currently facing us.  @HouseAgDems hearing on Wildfires https://t.co/Y4TZhH7Osz

Responding to the #2020Census is safe and confidential. Everyone regardless of immigration status should complete the #2020Census so our community gets the funding and representation it deserves. You can still complete your #2020Census at https://t.co/lKvF2hlfxs

The President's payroll tax plan is unpopular ineffective & harmful to our nation's #1 financial security program. I am proud to cosponsor the #SaveOurSocialSecurityNow Act to stop the executive action - the first step toward defunding dismantling & destroying #SocialSecurity. https://t.co/Qtxd2FVA29

House Democrats have passed over 340 bipartisan bills #ForThePeople that are stuck in the Senate. Bills to lower health care costs raise wages by rebuilding America and clean up corruption & strengthen our democracy – all stuck on Sen. McConnell’s desk. https://t.co/niaOg0PK6a

Participating in our democracy is critically important. Did you know checking your voter registration takes less than 5 minutes? Be sure you are registered to vote on #NationalVoterRegistrationDay by visiting https://t.co/5XUdus5UXR now.

Time is running out to complete the Census!   Filling out the #2020Census is an easy secure and important way to fight against injustices and ensure our community has equal representation! Get counted today at https://t.co/lKvF2hlfxs #SavetheCensus

Today we lost an icon. Justice Ruth Bader Ginsberg was only 5'1 in stature but moved mountains to propel our nation forward. She paved the way for so many & I'm thankful for her contributions. America will forever be shaped for the better because of #RBG https://t.co/IbZoaQwmDu

In 1994 I spearheaded the #Rosewood bill to provide $2M to the surviving members of the #RosewoodMassacre. The bill was the first time in US history a government acknowledged its role in racism & economic harm toward African Americans & compensated them. https://t.co/92MI7yLMci

Nineteen years ago today we experienced one of the most horrific terrorist attacks our nation has ever lived through. We remember the 3000 lives stolen & honor the courage of our first responders. The heroism shown that day reminds us to continue to rise together. #NeverForget https://t.co/a3osnIRWLr

Throughout the year – especially during #SuicidePreventionWeek – it is important to let veterans in crisis know that help is available.  The Veterans Crisis Line can be reached 24/7 by: • Calling 1-800-273-8255 & pressing 1  • Visiting https://t.co/OXv4U89WJY  • Texting 838255

|Since this pandemic began: 💼Millions of jobs have been lost 🏚 Families have been evicted from their homes States can't afford inaction. Congress must act now to #SaveOurStates. Pass the #HeroesAct NOW! || #SOS #FL|

The Trump Administration’s failure to lead during this global pandemic has left states with their backs against the wall when it comes to providing residents with: 🏠 Rental assistance 🚌 Safe public transportation 📚 Safe reopening of schools 🏬 Small biz aid #SaveOurStates #FL

#COVID19 Drive-Thru Testing available this week in Jefferson & Madison counties:  Jefferson County  September 10 8-11 am RJ Bailer Library 375 S. Water St Monticello FL   Madison County September 10 1-4 pm Haffye Hayes Park US 90 and Pitt St Greenville FL https://t.co/fM3KjydDu1

Happy #CollegeColorsDay! I am a proud graduate of @FAMU_1887 and @FloridaState. Although this year's celebration may look a little different we can still show our support for the teams and colleges we love. #UnitedWeFan  What colors are you repping today? #GoNoles #GoRattlers 🐍 https://t.co/h7NKgg28bo

Seventy five years ago #WWII officially came to an end. We are forever grateful for the servicemembers – and the allies who fought alongside them in Europe and the Pacific – for their bravery and sacrifice. https://t.co/8lo0AauGAQ

Join me tonight for my Virtual Military Academy Day 6 – 7:30PM. Recruiters from West Point US Naval Academy  US Air Force Academy the US Coast Guard Academy &  US Merchant Marines Academy will be on the call: https://t.co/k8rlhmQlmS ID: 814 3359 1612; Passcode: 697886 https://t.co/bTtBuLyMfZ

My art competition winner created this self portrait after watching #BlackPanther and seeing a reflection of himself on the screen. Chadwick Boseman inspired so many boys and girls to believe they too could be superheroes and for that I say thank you King 👑 #WakandaForever 🙅🏾 https://t.co/BZ5ZU2fi1I

Today we commemorate the 60th anniversary of Ax Handle Saturday & honor local foot soldiers who stood up for justice. Last week I introduced H.Res1088 to designate James Weldon Johnson Park in #Jacksonville as part of the Nat'l Park Service's African American Civil Rights Network https://t.co/PBQDLx6Z0D
Are you signed up for my eNewsletter? Get the latest updates from my office sent directly to your email: https://t.co/zBdxE2c7sP https://t.co/DnK6UOG8aO
@DebskiMike Thank you!!
@ColChrisMiller Thank you.
And now these three remain: faith hope and love. But the greatest of these is love. 1 Corinthians 13:13 https://t.co/xuVAdbZD9F

This week I testified about #agriculture production in the state & region. Home to over 590000 acres of farmland #FL05 is a microcosm of #FL’s #ag economy. Unfortunately there have been detrimental impacts from the Mexican dumping policies on our fruit & vegetable industries. https://t.co/8x1Wen4Hsw

To the students teachers administrators returning to school in-person & virtually I wish you the best this year. It takes a village to ensure our kids are getting a quality education. I applaud you (& our amazing parents) for taking on this task under such stressful times #TBT https://t.co/uN5jBt01Yz
#Jacksonville — Please be aware of scammers posing as JEA employees. #FL05 https://t.co/Lr6C46NmUJ

Pursuing a military education is a remarkable way for students to advance their academic careers while serving their country. I am proud of the students I've nominated to our nation's military academies in the past years. For more info visit https://t.co/ezza2QDHwv #FL05 https://t.co/WQsGQCCABj

Americans count on the Postal Service to deliver so much more than their letters. Social security benefits prescriptions paychecks tax returns and ballots all make their way to Americans via @USPS. RT if you agree: #DontMessWithUSPS! https://t.co/0aiGXly5qm

#OTD in 1935 President Roosevelt signed the Social Security Act into law. #SocialSecurity has offered assistance to retirees workers with disabilities & survivors of deceased family members. We must recommit ourselves to enhancing this program and protecting it. #SocSec85 https://t.co/6kBUyYUFQG
A real piece of work #SaveTheUSPS https://t.co/bmw8mNh28e

Join me for my Virtual #MilitaryAcademyDay on August 31. Representatives from the Military Academy at West Point the Naval Academy the Air Force Academy the Coast Guard Academy & the Merchant Marines Academy will the discuss admissions process. https://t.co/ezza2QDHwv #FL05 https://t.co/3DxtXyd5i2

With schools reopening our first priority must be the health & safety of students staff and their families. I led a letter to Gov. Desantis expressing concern over the mandate to reopen physical school locations during the pandemic. Districts should decide how to safely reopen. https://t.co/BRHjQrCwrY

Today I spoke with the Florida Alliance for Retired Americans (FLARA) about Medicare Medicaid Social Security the Voting Rights Act and other issues affecting the 5th District. I was also presented with the HERO Award for my 100 percent pro-retiree voting record. #FL05 https://t.co/WijrIVg8mO
Happy Birthday Mr. President https://t.co/FjO4E86sdH

Thank you to everyone who joined our Minority Small Business Roundtable. If you have additional questions feel free to contact my office at https://t.co/io8o5pVwPQ. Deadline to apply for #PPP is August 8. #SmallBusiness #ShopSmall #smallbusinessowner #FL05 #MinorityBusiness https://t.co/WMbzxNV9xG

The deadline to apply for #PPP is August 8. Join me via Facebook Live today at NOON for a roundtable discussion on the impact of #COVID19 on minority businesses. Please feel free to ask questions #FL05 #SmallBusiness #MinorityOwnedBusinesses #ShopSmall https://t.co/YRuZZeqZRf

The deadline to apply for the Paycheck Protection Program is Aug 8. We had an excellent small business discussion earlier this month I am hosting another roundtable tomorrow Aug 1 at Noon. Join me on Facebook Live as we answer your questions about issues you may be facing #FL05 https://t.co/WNPQC8OxOz

More than 4.3 million people. That’s how many confirmed cases there have been in America. Children are going hungry & families are struggling to make rent.  In what world do business lunches rank as more important than helping our most vulnerable? https://t.co/L4irNcbEF4

The Commission on the Social Status of Black Men and Boys will develop policy solutions to help create an environment that will enable black males to achieve their full potential. I am proud to be a sponsor of this long-overdue legislation #BlackMenAndBoysAct #FL05 https://t.co/HcJvbiCjOT
COVID-19 testing taking place tomorrow in Havana. #FL05 https://t.co/wENby97Hql

Join me tonight at 6PM on Facebook Live for a virtual chat with #Jacksonville minority small business owners as we discuss the challenges they have faced during the #COVID19 pandemic #FL05 #SmallBiz https://t.co/YRuZZe9oZH

I’m hosting a Photo Contest to showcase the beauty of #FL05. The photo will be featured on my social media pages. Submit your high-resolution photo with your name and where the photo was taken to lawsonphotocontest@gmail.com. One entry per person. Deadline is Friday July 31. https://t.co/pbFkP1DM5i

#COVID19 pandemic has been challenging for all small businesses but minority-owned businesses face distinct barriers that add to their struggles. Join me tonight at 6PM for a virtual chat with #Jacksonville minority small business owners. #FL05 https://t.co/M6wCh2kAOn

I sit on the Financial Service Committee @FSCDems with  @RepAOC and she is intelligent passionate and a fighter for her community. Calling her out of her name is unacceptable. We can disagree but we should never be disrespectful. https://t.co/kJD52Puosh
You will always have my support. https://t.co/BG5PlFmUux
I was honored to talk about my dear friend #JohnLewis. https://t.co/kzKOm4ryw2

Do you have a great pic of your favorite place in #FL05 that you’d like to share? I’m hosting a #PhotoContest to showcase the beauty of our district. The photo will be featured on my social media. Submit your high-res photo to lawsonphotocontest@gmail.com. Deadline:July 31. https://t.co/ZiyyQlsIaK

We've lost a giant with the passing of @RepJohnLewis. He was a humble leader who dedicated his life to service. When we talk about a Champion for the People #JohnLewis is the embodiment of the title. He was my hero and my friend. #GoodTrouble #RestInPower https://t.co/YId83zB8GJ

My office has recovered more than $3.4M for the people of #FL05 through casework. We were able to return these funds by cutting through red tape expediting money owed from the IRS & securing benefits from agencies like the VA & SSA. For assistance visit https://t.co/92Q7HX1lSB.

I had to fill up my tank at the first Black-owned BP gas station in #Florida. Owner Kim Walker’s story of hard work is nothing short of inspiring. I have no doubt that this station will become a staple in the #Jacksonville community for years to come.  #FL05 https://t.co/APzpudrlPK

The Trump Administration is pressuring the CDC to issue ‘less restrictive’ guidelines for schools to reopen & is threatening to withhold funds from states that do not reopen. This is not only incredibly irresponsible it is dangerous. https://t.co/hJrJrD3RN2

It’s frustrating to hear #SCOTUS voted in favor of allowing more employers to opt out of the #ACA mandate for reproductive care. Women should have the right to take care of their bodies as they see fit & have access to preventive care. SCOTUS got it wrong https://t.co/W5zHUzkku0
More testing sites are available in our district #FL05. Please do all that you can to prevent the spread of COVID-19. https://t.co/iceOMBuxRq

#Jacksonville Electric Authority (JEA) is pushing back disconnect day to July 9. Last month I urged the mayor to extend the deadline. Water & electricity are essential during these challenging times. It would be unfair to leave thousands in the dark #FL05 https://t.co/Tcfaw8MWfw
@JEA @NewsfromJEA Sorry about that.

@JEA is pushing back the disconnect day to July 9 instead of July 7.  Last month I urged the mayor to extend the deadline. Running water & electricity are essential during these challenging times. It would be unfair to leave thousands in the dark #FL05 https://t.co/dtEZus1FVe

Major holidays like #IndependenceDay may trigger unanticipated stress and anxiety for veterans experiencing #PTSD. For those experiencing a #MentalHealth crisis the Veterans Crisis line is here to help:  Dial: 1-800-273-8255 & press 1 Visit: https://t.co/EsyDfvX40O Text: 838255

I want to wish everyone a happy & safe #4thofJuly2020!Today is more than a celebration—it’s a day to recommit ourselves to the promise of a more just & perfect nation. Together we must confront the past & work to build a future where the blessings of liberty can be enjoyed by all https://t.co/YPdldhYEi6
With the holiday weekend here and stores reopening remember to practice #SocialDistancing when you are out and about. And of course #WearAMask #SixFeetApart https://t.co/StbkmN3En8

The #MovingForward Act invests more than $1.5 trillion in our crumbling infrastructure while creating millions of jobs combatting the climate crisis and addressing disparities in our communities. Through HR 2 #Florida will receive $16673864161 in highway and transit funding. https://t.co/Jmase3eZf6
Words to live by #WearAMask #SaveALife https://t.co/enEOmW6YMC

Today is the last day to apply for Paycheck Protection Program funding for your small businesses. This funding is available through the CARES Act. To apply visit https://t.co/YQZeDAIdS5 #FL05 #SmallBusiness

Congratulations to #FL05 Congressional Art Competition winner Desiree Thompson a student at @PaceCenterJax. Her artwork will be displayed in the Capitol for a year. Thank you to the teachers and parents who supported all of our talented students' efforts. https://t.co/OR3K09YjbQ

Since the Shelby V Holder ruling voter suppression has only increased. Gerrymandering voter ID laws restrictions on early voting are forms of suppression that take the power away from the voters. Voter suppression is a threat to democracy. #RestoreTheVote https://t.co/RjUTZm0imQ
New COVID-19 Testing Sites available around #Jacksonville. #GetTested practice social distancing #WearAMask #WashYourHands and stay safe! #DuvalCounty #TestingSitesFL https://t.co/Sx1xfDKvbr

I’m appreciative for the work Bishop Hall is doing in the #Jacksonville community— ensuring families receive the support they need during these difficult times. His commitment to #Jax is legendary and we’re blessed to have him in #FL05. #FacesOfFlorida https://t.co/h7uQsPUmeR

Happy #FathersDay to the dads across #FL05 and around the globe. I hope your day is surrounded by family and loved ones.   And kids remember to FaceTime your dads today. We're getting better and better with this technology thing every day. #DadJoke https://t.co/sKjMuQXQja

Happy birthday to my dear friend Sollie. He turned 102 today and is a World War II veteran. I asked him what he wanted for his birthday and he said “Breakfast!” 🧁🧁#AmericanHero #FL05 https://t.co/xuIler5fiA

The statewide Census response rate is 58.7% but the response rate in #FL05 is 55.1%. Completing the #2020Census will help ensure our community gets the resources it needs and has equal representation in the future. #Census2020 https://t.co/mLtt2LQmbT

#DidYourKnow historically Black communities are always undercounted during the Census? The Census shapes political representation and the allocation of public funding over the next decade? #BeCounted https://t.co/07EN7X7FEc

Today we celebrate #Juneteenth and commemorate the end of slavery in the United States. On June 19 1865 the last forcibly enslaved Americans were freed. However the fight for justice and equality CONTINUES. Change is long overdue. #FL05 https://t.co/ChgWdt4ikk

We will vote on the #JusticeInPolicing Act next week.  ✅Bans chokeholds;  ✅Ends no-knock warrants  ✅Takes weapons made for war away from our local police force & off our streets.  The Senate proposal & Trump's Executive Order does not. #OneOfTheseThingsIsNotLikeTheOthers https://t.co/eheGMFHmOJ

Humbled to be a part of #OluwatoyinSalau’s Memorial Service in Tallahassee. She was brave she was strong & she stood firm in her purpose.  Though she was taken from us her voice lives on through her friends loved ones & all of us in this fight #JusticeForToyin #SayHerName #blm https://t.co/tC1mlEeCBF

Oluwatoyin Salau deserved better. She used her voice as a #BlackLivesMatter activist to advocate for those who have been silenced. Days ago her light was violently extinguished. Black women deserve to be seen protected & heard. #HerLifeMattered #JusticeforToyin #SayHerName https://t.co/nbNzDjfWwU

Dreamers are a vital part of our communities – always looking for opportunities to make America stronger. Thank you again to the Supreme Court. This diverse group of ambitious individuals is what our country needs to continue to flourish. #HomeIsHere  https://t.co/cwzfiX257U

Shutting off power & water to Jacksonville families & seniors  struggling during this crisis will have a detrimental impact if the JEA disconnection moratorium expires July 7. It's reported 22000 accounts will be disconnected. I've urged Mayor Curry to extend the deadline #FL05 https://t.co/cmO7TJRu7i

The deaths of #Oluwatoyin Salau & Victoria Sims have been a hard hit not just to our #Tallahassee community but across our nation. Toyin was an activist model & student. Victoria was a retired state employee & @AARP volunteer. #ToyinSalau #VictoriaSims #FL05 #blm #SayHerName https://t.co/34CRx16WFz

Today would've been the 149th birthday of activist educator & #Jacksonville native James Weldon Johnson. Johnson wrote "Lift Ev'ry Voice and Sing." This year we celebrated the 120th anniversary of the song. He remains an inspiration to us all. #FL05 #Jax https://t.co/PeIDzsEln9

Now through August 7 Second Harvest will deliver free meals for kids ages 9-18 in #Tallahassee neighborhoods as listed. Additionally free lunch & snacks will be available at partner locations: https://t.co/f9rBAVvJtl. #SummerBreakSpot  #FL05 #FreeMealsForKids https://t.co/R8sxHipL2S

Athletes have always been on the frontline with conversations on race relations & the push for social change — Tommie Smith John Carlos LeBron Jackie Robinson Jesse Owens Muhammad Ali Kaepernick. I applaud players for raising their voices https://t.co/wVwqecP189 @TDOnline

Today's ruling is another step in the right direction and places us on a path towards true equality and equal rights for all. Thanks to the Supreme Court for being wise and fair and to all whose activism & courage made this victory possible.  https://t.co/IdreEvJjdR #LoveWins

In the same week two communities in #FL05 — #Jacksonville & #Quincy — removed #ConfederateMonuments from display. As we move forward as "One Nation Under God" these painful reminders of America's violent and bigoted past have no place in our society. https://t.co/6ct2gH1GH2

Congratulations @GOToTCC on this national recognition.   With the faculty's commitment to student achievement students leave TCC better prepared to take on the next step in their professional careers. https://t.co/SlPwKvcX1M

Now is not the time to be timid in our response to racial injustice. The Justice in Policing Act will hold police accountable to the communities they serve end police brutality and transform the culture of policing in our country. https://t.co/rFxBDh8GOR

During this pandemic when almost everything has slowed down or stopped it is evident that racism in America has not. https://t.co/xozYV3Ktc4

@Kene_Chale Keep fighting to make sure your voice is heard. Hold people accountable -- community leaders elected officials etc. Young people carry so much power and your passion for justice is what we need to make this world better.
Positive news! #Florida's eviction moratorium has been extended through July 1. https://t.co/9hP8EW4UQh #FloridaEvictionStories #FL05

The state’s eviction moratorium is set to expire tomorrow. We have millions still struggling to access their unemployment benefits -- primarily due to a faulty website. @GovRonDeSantis​ should extend the current residential eviction moratorium #FloridaEvictionStories #FL05 https://t.co/N4Kpq5k68K

Today we observe June 1 as the National Day of Mourning and Lament. Over 100000 lives have been lost in this country because of COVID-19. Today we honor them. Their lives will never be forgotten. #Lament100K https://t.co/4DREA0oDfi #FL05

To the oppressed disenfranchised & those who are sick & tired of being sick & tired I see you. The world hears you. While I do not condone the violence or looting I respect the right to peacefully protest. Now we must come together listen to one another & find real solutions

In these trying times we must be our brother’s keeper & look out for our neighbors. Food insecurity affects our children our families and our communities. Join my team for a #FarmShare distribution tomorrow May 30 at Abyssinia Missionary Baptist Church in #Jacksonville. #FL05 https://t.co/rTZAhRvC2y

Thank you to Quincy native Zachary Woods who has worked on the frontlines as an emergency room nurse in a New York City hospital during the #COVID19 pandemic. Woods has been a nurse for seven years. #NotAllHeroesWearCapes #FL05 via @gadcotimes   https://t.co/weGB8dtLc3 https://t.co/HROdt1iA8k

It seems like everyday we're seeing new videos of senseless killings: #GeorgeFloyd #AhmaudArbery #BreonnaTaylor. Our children should be able to live in a world where they're not seen as the enemy. The Dept of Justice must open an investigation of Mr. Floyd’s death #ICantBreathe https://t.co/ocJPyzNQZi

The initial $6.1B relief for our students & universities was not enough. Students are facing financial hardships due to off-campus #studenthousing obligations. I led a letter with 53 other Members urging Leadership to include funding in the next relief package to help students. https://t.co/JXDVbNv0Y3

The impact #COVID19 on daily routines may cause unanticipated stress on our nation's #veterans. It is important to keep reaching out to those in need of someone to talk to. The VA created the COVID Coach app to help vets cope with stress and anxiety. https://t.co/yeFUtDObNV #FL05

I marked today's occasion by placing flags on the graves of soldiers buried in #FL05 including my father's who fought in World War II. This #MemorialDay we honor those who made the ultimate sacrifice in the name of freedom. Through their valiant efforts our democracy lives on https://t.co/lifMDHMxK1

#Classof2020 — Today we celebrate your accomplishments the lessons you've learned the friends you've made and the possibilities that are ahead. Remember that each day is a day to be better and do better than before. Make mistakes learn from them and push forward You got this! https://t.co/9UKHbSKCaD

Many #farmers have lost business due to #COVID19. Consider applying for financial aid under the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. The CFAP will provide $16 billion to #ag producers who have suffered losses during the pandemic https://t.co/znhgiCizwg #FL05
